$description: Component manifest for AI/MCP consumption. Maps user intent to components with semantic descriptions, props, accessibility info, and usage patterns.

button.name: Button
button.description: Interactive button component for user actions. Supports multiple visual variants and sizes with full keyboard navigation and ARIA support.
intent: user wants to trigger an action
user needs a clickable element
user wants to submit a form
user needs a call-to-action
user needs a destructive action confirmation trigger

variant.description: Visual style variant. Primary for main actions, secondary for less important actions, outline for subtle actions, ghost for minimal UI, danger for destructive actions.

size.description: Button size. Small for compact UIs, medium for default, large for emphasis.

asChild.description: Render as a child element (e.g., Link component) using Radix Slot

disabled.description: Disables interaction and applies disabled styling

accessibility.focusManagement: Automatic focus ring on keyboard navigation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - meets 7:1 contrast ratio

usage.when: User needs to perform an action (submit, navigate, trigger event)
usage.avoid: Don't use for navigation alone (use Link instead with asChild), don't use for toggles (use Switch/Checkbox)

input.name: Input
input.description: Text input field for user data entry. Supports all HTML input types with consistent styling and validation states.
intent: user needs to enter text
user needs to provide input data
user wants to fill out a form field
user needs to search or filter

type.description: HTML input type (text, email, password, number, tel, url, search, etc.)

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown when input is empty

onChange.description: Callback fired when input value changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on keyboard navigation, clear focus indicator
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - label contrast, focus indicators, error messaging

usage.when: User needs to enter text, numbers, or other input data
usage.avoid: Don't use for large text (use Textarea), don't use for selections (use Select), don't use without labels

label.name: Label
label.description: Accessible label for form fields. Provides automatic association to form controls via htmlFor and adapts styling when peer input is disabled.
intent: user needs to label a form field
user wants accessible text for an input
user needs to associate text with a control

htmlFor.description: ID of the form element this label is associated with

accessibility.focusManagement: Clicking label focuses the associated form control
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - provides programmatic label association

usage.when: Every form field needs a visible label for accessibility
usage.avoid: Don't use without associating to a form control, use VisuallyHidden if label should be hidden

checkbox.name: Checkbox
checkbox.description: Boolean input with check indicator. Supports checked, unchecked, and indeterminate states with full keyboard navigation.
intent: user needs a boolean toggle
user wants to accept terms
user needs to select multiple options
user wants a checkmark input

checked.description: Controlled checked state. Supports true, false, and 'indeterminate'.

defaultChecked.description: Default checked state for uncontrolled usage

onCheckedChange.description: Callback fired when checked state changes. Receives boolean | 'indeterminate'.

required.description: Marks the checkbox as required for form validation

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on keyboard navigation, peer disabled state propagation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - contrast, focus indicators, state announcements

usage.when: User needs to toggle a boolean value or select multiple options from a list
usage.avoid: Don't use for mutually exclusive options (use RadioGroup), don't use for on/off settings (prefer Switch)

radio-group.name: RadioGroup
radio-group.description: Single selection from a group of options. Composed of RadioGroup (container) and RadioGroupItem (individual options).
intent: user needs to choose one option from several
user wants mutually exclusive selection
user needs radio buttons
user wants single-select options

defaultValue.description: Default selected value for uncontrolled usage

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when selection changes. Receives the selected value string.

disabled.description: Disables all radio items in the group

orientation.description: Layout direction of the radio group

keyboardNavigation: Arrow keys to navigate between items
accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex within group, arrow key navigation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - group labelling, keyboard navigation

usage.when: User must choose exactly one option from a predefined set
usage.avoid: Don't use for multi-select (use Checkbox), don't use for large option sets (use Select)

examples.code:
<RadioGroup value={plan} onValueChange={setPlan}>
  <RadioGroupItem value="free" id="free" />
  <RadioGroupItem value="pro" id="pro" />
</RadioGroup>

switch.name: Switch
switch.description: Toggle switch for on/off settings. Provides a visual sliding toggle with smooth animation.
intent: user wants to toggle a setting on or off
user needs a boolean switch
user wants to enable/disable a feature
user needs an on/off control

defaultChecked.description: Default checked state for uncontrolled usage

onCheckedChange.description: Callback fired when checked state changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on keyboard navigation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - clear on/off visual state

usage.when: User needs to toggle a setting that takes effect immediately (e.g., dark mode, notifications)
usage.avoid: Don't use for form submissions (use Checkbox), don't use for multiple options (use Checkbox group)

select.name: Select
select.description: Dropdown select for choosing from a list of options. Compound component: Select, SelectTrigger, SelectValue, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectGroup, SelectLabel, SelectSeparator.
intent: user needs to choose from a dropdown list
user wants a select box
user needs a dropdown menu for form selection
user wants to pick one option from many

open.description: Controlled open state of the dropdown

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped within dropdown when open, returns to trigger on close
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full keyboard operation, scroll buttons for overflow

usage.when: User needs to pick one option from 5+ items, or when space is limited
usage.avoid: Don't use for 2-3 options (use RadioGroup), don't use for multi-select (use Checkbox group)

examples.code:
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger className="w-[180px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select a fruit" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="apple">Apple</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="banana">Banana</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="cherry">Cherry</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

slider.name: Slider
slider.description: Range input with draggable thumb for selecting numeric values within a range.
intent: user needs to select a value from a range
user wants a range slider
user needs to adjust a numeric value visually
user wants a volume or brightness control

value.description: Controlled value array (supports single or dual thumb)

onValueCommit.description: Callback fired when thumb is released (final value)

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on thumb, keyboard adjustable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - keyboard operable, value announcements

usage.when: User needs to select a value from a continuous range (volume, price, etc.)
usage.avoid: Don't use for precise numeric entry (use Input type=number), don't use for discrete options (use RadioGroup)

textarea.name: Textarea
textarea.description: Multi-line text input for longer form content. Supports all HTML textarea attributes with consistent styling.
intent: user needs multi-line text input
user wants to write a message or description
user needs a comment box
user wants a large text field

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown when textarea is empty

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on keyboard navigation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - label association, focus indicators

usage.when: User needs to enter more than a single line of text (messages, descriptions, comments)
usage.avoid: Don't use for single-line input (use Input), don't use for rich text (use a rich text editor)

form-field.name: FormField
form-field.description: Composite form field that links label, control, helper text, and error message with automatic aria-describedby. Sub-components: FormField, FormLabel, FormControl, FormHelperText, FormErrorMessage.
intent: user needs a complete form field with label and validation
user wants accessible form inputs with error messages
user needs to compose label + input + helper text
user wants form validation feedback

id.description: Unique field ID used for aria-describedby linkage between label, input, helper text, and error message

error.description: Error message to display. When set, aria-invalid is added to the control.

helperText.description: Helper text displayed below the field for guidance

accessibility.focusManagement: Context-driven: FormControl clones aria props onto child input
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - programmatic label, error, and description association

usage.when: Building any form with labels, helper text, or validation error messages
usage.avoid: Don't use for standalone labels without inputs, overkill for simple search fields

examples.code:
<FormField id="email" error={errors.email} helperText="We'll never share your email.">
  <FormLabel>Email</FormLabel>
  <FormControl>
    <Input type="email" placeholder="you@example.com" />
  </FormControl>
  <FormHelperText />
  <FormErrorMessage />
</FormField>

<FormField id="name" helperText="Enter your full name">
  <FormLabel>Full Name</FormLabel>
  <FormControl>
    <Input placeholder="John Doe" />
  </FormControl>
  <FormHelperText />
</FormField>

link.name: Link
link.description: Styled hyperlink with automatic external link detection. External links open in new tab with an icon indicator.
intent: user needs a hyperlink
user wants navigation to another page
user needs an external link with indicator
user wants styled anchor text

external.description: Force external treatment (new tab + icon). Auto-detected for http:// and // URLs.

ariaSupport: target=_blank with rel=noopener noreferrer for external
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on keyboard navigation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - visible link styling, external link indicator

usage.when: User needs to navigate to another page or external resource
usage.avoid: Don't use for actions (use Button), don't use inside buttons

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: Modal dialog for focused user interactions. Compound component: Dialog, DialogTrigger, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogDescription, DialogFooter, DialogClose.
intent: user needs a modal dialog
user wants a popup form
user needs to confirm an action
user wants to display focused content overlay
user needs a modal window

defaultOpen.description: Default open state for uncontrolled usage

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

modal.description: Whether the dialog blocks interaction with the rest of the page

keyboardNavigation: Tab to cycle focus within dialog
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped within dialog, returns to trigger on close. Close button has sr-only label.
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - focus trap, escape to close, screen reader announcements

usage.when: User needs to complete a focused task (form, confirmation) that blocks the main content
usage.avoid: Don't use for non-blocking info (use Popover or Toast), don't nest dialogs

examples.code:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant="outline">Edit Profile</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogHeader>
      <DialogTitle>Edit Profile</DialogTitle>
      <DialogDescription>Make changes to your profile.</DialogDescription>
    </DialogHeader>
    <Input placeholder="Name" />
    <DialogFooter>
      <Button type="submit">Save</Button>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

popover.name: Popover
popover.description: Floating popover for displaying rich content anchored to a trigger element. Compound component: Popover, PopoverTrigger, PopoverContent, PopoverAnchor.
intent: user needs a floating panel of content
user wants a popover form or picker
user needs non-modal floating UI
user wants content anchored to a button

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

sideOffset.description: Distance from trigger in pixels (on PopoverContent)

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus moves to content on open, returns to trigger on close
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - keyboard operable, dismissible

usage.when: User needs floating content that doesn't block the page (color picker, date picker, filters)
usage.avoid: Don't use for simple hover info (use Tooltip), don't use for blocking content (use Dialog)

tooltip.name: Tooltip
tooltip.description: Small popup displaying additional information on hover or focus. Compound component: TooltipProvider, Tooltip, TooltipTrigger, TooltipContent.
intent: user needs hover information
user wants to show a hint on hover
user needs an icon button label
user wants supplementary info on focus

delayDuration.description: Delay in ms before showing tooltip (on TooltipProvider)

sideOffset.description: Distance from trigger in pixels (on TooltipContent)

side.description: Preferred side for tooltip placement (on TooltipContent)

accessibility.focusManagement: Shows on focus and hover, dismisses on escape
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - keyboard accessible, not blocking

usage.when: User needs supplementary text on hover (icon labels, abbreviation explanations)
usage.avoid: Don't use for interactive content (use Popover), don't use for essential information (content must be accessible without hover)

dropdown-menu.name: DropdownMenu
dropdown-menu.description: Dropdown menu for actions and options. Full compound component: DropdownMenu, DropdownMenuTrigger, DropdownMenuContent, DropdownMenuItem, DropdownMenuCheckboxItem, DropdownMenuRadioItem, DropdownMenuLabel, DropdownMenuSeparator, DropdownMenuShortcut, DropdownMenuGroup, DropdownMenuSub, DropdownMenuSubTrigger, DropdownMenuSubContent, DropdownMenuRadioGroup.
intent: user needs a dropdown with actions
user wants a context-style action menu
user needs a menu with keyboard shortcuts
user wants nested menu items
user needs checkbox or radio items in a menu

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

inset.description: Adds left padding for items with icons or indicators (on MenuItem/SubTrigger/Label)

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped in menu, roving tabindex, auto-focus first item on open
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full keyboard navigation, typeahead search

usage.when: User needs a menu of actions triggered by a button (settings, more actions, user menu)
usage.avoid: Don't use for form selection (use Select), don't use for navigation (use NavigationMenu)

context-menu.name: ContextMenu
context-menu.description: Right-click context menu. Mirrors DropdownMenu structure. Compound component: ContextMenu, ContextMenuTrigger, ContextMenuContent, ContextMenuItem, ContextMenuCheckboxItem, ContextMenuRadioItem, ContextMenuLabel, ContextMenuSeparator, ContextMenuShortcut, ContextMenuSub, ContextMenuSubTrigger, ContextMenuSubContent, ContextMenuRadioGroup.
intent: user needs a right-click menu
user wants context-sensitive actions
user needs a secondary action menu on right-click
user wants custom context menu replacing browser default

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

inset.description: Adds left padding for items with icons (on MenuItem/SubTrigger/Label)

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped in menu, roving tabindex
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - keyboard operable, typeahead search

usage.when: User needs right-click actions on specific content areas (file browsers, editors, canvas)
usage.avoid: Don't use as the only way to access actions (always provide alternatives), don't use on mobile

examples.code:
<ContextMenu>
  <ContextMenuTrigger className="h-[150px] w-[300px] border border-dashed">
    Right click here
  </ContextMenuTrigger>
  <ContextMenuContent>
    <ContextMenuItem>Cut</ContextMenuItem>
    <ContextMenuItem>Copy</ContextMenuItem>
    <ContextMenuItem>Paste</ContextMenuItem>
  </ContextMenuContent>
</ContextMenu>

hover-card.name: HoverCard
hover-card.description: Rich hover preview for displaying additional content on hover. Compound component: HoverCard, HoverCardTrigger, HoverCardContent.
intent: user needs a rich preview on hover
user wants a profile card on hover
user needs link preview on hover
user wants a preview popup

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

keyboardNavigation: Content accessible on focus of trigger
accessibility.focusManagement: Non-blocking, does not trap focus
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - supplementary content, not required for operation

usage.when: User needs rich preview on hover (user profiles, link previews, product cards)
usage.avoid: Don't use for essential information, don't use for interactive forms (use Popover), don't use for simple text (use Tooltip)

examples.code:
@username

Username

Bio text here

sheet.name: Sheet
sheet.description: Side drawer panel that slides in from any edge. Built on Radix Dialog. Compound component: Sheet, SheetTrigger, SheetContent, SheetHeader, SheetTitle, SheetDescription, SheetFooter, SheetClose.
intent: user needs a side panel
user wants a drawer for settings or details
user needs a mobile navigation menu
user wants a sliding panel from the side

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

side.description: Edge from which the sheet slides in (on SheetContent)

keyboardNavigation: Tab to cycle focus within sheet
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped within sheet, returns to trigger on close. Close button has sr-only label.
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - focus trap, escape to close

usage.when: User needs supplementary content or forms in a side panel (navigation, settings, detail views)
usage.avoid: Don't use for critical confirmations (use Dialog or AlertDialog), don't use for small content (use Popover)

examples.code:
Settings Adjust your preferences.
Settings content here

toast.name: Toast
toast.description: Notification toast with variants. Supports swipe to dismiss. Compound component: ToastProvider, ToastViewport, Toast, ToastTitle, ToastDescription, ToastClose, ToastAction.
intent: user needs a notification message
user wants a success/error toast
user needs a temporary notification
user wants to show feedback after an action

variant.description: Visual style variant indicating toast type

duration.description: Auto-dismiss duration in ms. Set to Infinity to disable auto-dismiss.

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Toast does not steal focus, actions are focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - non-blocking, screen reader announcements

usage.when: User needs brief feedback after an action (save success, error notification, warning)
usage.avoid: Don't use for persistent messages (use Alert), don't use for confirmations (use Dialog)

alert-dialog.name: AlertDialog
alert-dialog.description: Confirmation dialog that interrupts the user for critical actions. Requires explicit user response. Uses @radix-ui/react-alert-dialog.
intent: user needs a confirmation before destructive action
user wants a blocking confirmation dialog
user needs a yes/no decision dialog
user wants to prevent accidental deletions

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

keyboardNavigation: Tab to cycle between Cancel and Confirm
Escape does NOT close (intentional for critical actions)
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped, no click-outside dismiss, requires explicit action
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - cannot be accidentally dismissed

usage.when: User is about to perform an irreversible or destructive action (delete, discard changes)
usage.avoid: Don't use for non-critical confirmations (use Dialog), don't use for informational messages (use Toast or Alert)

examples.code:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant="danger">Delete Account</Button>
  </AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent>
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Are you sure?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>This action cannot be undone.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>Cancel</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction>Delete</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

card.name: Card
card.description: Content container with border, background, and shadow. Compound component: Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter.
intent: user needs a content container
user wants a card layout
user needs a grouped content section
user wants a bordered panel with header and footer

className.description: Additional CSS class names for customizing card appearance

accessibility.role: region (when combined with aria-label) or generic container
accessibility.focusManagement: Card itself is not focusable; children manage their own focus
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - semantic heading in CardTitle

usage.when: User needs to group related content in a visually distinct container (profile cards, stats, settings groups)
usage.avoid: Don't nest cards within cards, don't use for full-page layouts

examples.code:
Total Revenue $45,231.89

+20.1% from last month

badge.name: Badge
badge.description: Status badge for labels and indicators. Small pill-shaped element with semantic color variants.
intent: user needs a status indicator
user wants a tag or label
user needs to highlight a state
user wants a count or category badge

variant.description: Visual style variant. Default for primary badges, destructive for errors, success for positive states, warning for caution.

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable by default. Add tabIndex if interactive.
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - color not the sole means of conveying status

usage.when: User needs to show status, category, or count (active/inactive, tags, notification counts)
usage.avoid: Don't use for actions (use Button), don't use for long text

alert.name: Alert
alert.description: Persistent message component for important information. Supports semantic variants with icon placement. Sub-components: Alert, AlertTitle, AlertDescription.
intent: user needs a persistent notification
user wants to display an error or warning message
user needs an info banner
user wants a callout block

variant.description: Visual style variant indicating alert severity

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable; content is announced by screen readers via role=alert
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - role=alert for screen readers, icon + color + text for status

usage.when: User needs to see a persistent important message (errors, warnings, success confirmations, info)
usage.avoid: Don't use for transient messages (use Toast), don't use for confirmations (use AlertDialog)

examples.code:
<Alert variant="error">
  <AlertTitle>Error</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>Something went wrong. Please try again.</AlertDescription>
</Alert>

skeleton.name: Skeleton
skeleton.description: Loading placeholder with pulse animation. Renders a gray pulsing block sized via className to mimic the content being loaded.
intent: user needs a loading placeholder
user wants a skeleton screen
user needs content loading animation
user wants to show a loading state

className.description: Width, height, and shape classes. Use h-*, w-*, and rounded-* to match target content.

ariaSupport: aria-hidden recommended, or aria-label='Loading' on container
accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - animated pulse respects prefers-reduced-motion

usage.when: Content is loading and you want to show the layout structure before data arrives
usage.avoid: Don't use for indeterminate loading (use Spinner), don't use without matching the content dimensions

spinner.name: Spinner
spinner.description: Animated SVG loading indicator with size variants. Renders a spinning circle with accessible label.
intent: user needs a loading spinner
user wants an inline loading indicator
user needs to show processing state
user wants a button loading state

size.description: Spinner size. sm=16px, md=24px, lg=32px, xl=48px.

label.description: Accessible label for screen readers via aria-label

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - accessible label, respects prefers-reduced-motion

usage.when: User needs to see that something is loading or processing (form submission, data fetch)
usage.avoid: Don't use for page-level loading (use Skeleton), don't use without a label for screen readers

tabs.name: Tabs
tabs.description: Tabbed content panels for organizing related content. Compound component: Tabs, TabsList, TabsTrigger, TabsContent.
intent: user needs tabbed content sections
user wants to switch between views
user needs a tab navigation interface
user wants organized content panels

defaultValue.description: Default active tab for uncontrolled usage

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when active tab changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex in tab list, tab panel receives focus on activation
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full keyboard navigation, ARIA tab pattern

usage.when: User needs to switch between related content sections without page navigation
usage.avoid: Don't use for page navigation (use NavigationMenu), don't use with only 1 tab

examples.code:
<Tabs defaultValue="account">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="account">Account</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="password">Password</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  <TabsContent value="account">Account settings here.</TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="password">Password settings here.</TabsContent>
</Tabs>

avatar.name: Avatar
avatar.description: User avatar with image and fallback. Compound component: Avatar, AvatarImage, AvatarFallback. Shows fallback (initials or icon) while image loads or on error.
intent: user needs a user profile image
user wants to display an avatar
user needs initials as fallback
user wants a user thumbnail

alt.description: Alt text for the avatar image (on AvatarImage)

delayMs.description: Delay before showing fallback, to prevent flash (on AvatarFallback)

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable by default
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - alt text for images, visible fallback

usage.when: User needs to display a profile picture with graceful fallback
usage.avoid: Don't use without alt text, don't use for decorative images (use img directly)

separator.name: Separator
separator.description: Visual divider line. Supports horizontal and vertical orientations.
intent: user needs a visual divider
user wants to separate content sections
user needs a horizontal or vertical line

decorative.description: When true, separator is hidden from accessibility tree (purely visual)

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - semantic separator role when meaningful

usage.when: User needs to visually divide content sections
usage.avoid: Don't use for spacing only (use CSS margin/padding), set decorative=false if the separator conveys meaning

progress.name: Progress
progress.description: Progress bar showing completion status. Displays a filled bar from 0 to 100.
intent: user needs a progress indicator
user wants to show completion percentage
user needs a loading bar
user wants to display upload or task progress

value.description: Progress value from 0 to 100. Omit for indeterminate state.

accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - announces progress to screen readers

usage.when: User needs to see how far along a process is (file upload, form completion, step progress)
usage.avoid: Don't use for indeterminate loading (use Spinner), don't use without providing a value

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.description: Collapsible content sections with animated expand/collapse. Compound component: Accordion, AccordionItem, AccordionTrigger, AccordionContent.
intent: user needs collapsible sections
user wants an FAQ layout
user needs expandable content areas
user wants to organize content vertically with show/hide

type.description: Whether one or multiple items can be open simultaneously

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when open items change

collapsible.description: When type='single', allows closing all items (otherwise one must stay open)

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex between triggers
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full keyboard navigation, ARIA accordion pattern

usage.when: User needs to organize multiple collapsible sections (FAQs, settings, long content lists)
usage.avoid: Don't use for single show/hide (use Collapsible), don't use for tabs (use Tabs)

examples.code:
<Accordion type="single" collapsible>
  <AccordionItem value="item-1">
    <AccordionTrigger>What is this?</AccordionTrigger>
    <AccordionContent>This is a design system component.</AccordionContent>
  </AccordionItem>
  <AccordionItem value="item-2">
    <AccordionTrigger>How do I use it?</AccordionTrigger>
    <AccordionContent>Import and compose the sub-components.</AccordionContent>
  </AccordionItem>
</Accordion>

collapsible.name: Collapsible
collapsible.description: Generic collapsible container for showing/hiding content. Compound component: Collapsible, CollapsibleTrigger, CollapsibleContent.
intent: user needs a simple show/hide toggle
user wants to collapse a section
user needs expandable content
user wants a toggle-able content area

onOpenChange.description: Callback fired when open state changes

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus on trigger element
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - disclosure widget pattern

usage.when: User needs a single collapsible section (advanced options, more info toggle)
usage.avoid: Don't use for multiple collapsible sections (use Accordion), don't use for tabs (use Tabs)

scroll-area.name: ScrollArea
scroll-area.description: Custom scrollbar container replacing native scrollbars. Compound component: ScrollArea, ScrollBar.
intent: user needs custom styled scrollbars
user wants a scrollable container
user needs consistent scroll behavior across browsers
user wants a scrollable list or content area

accessibility.focusManagement: Viewport is focusable for keyboard scrolling
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - keyboard scrollable, touch accessible

usage.when: User needs a scrollable area with custom styled scrollbars (sidebars, long lists, code blocks)
usage.avoid: Don't use for full-page scrolling, don't use when native scrollbars are acceptable

examples.code:
{items.map(item =>
{item}
)}
{images.map(img => )}

aspect-ratio.name: AspectRatio
aspect-ratio.description: Container that maintains a specified aspect ratio for its children (images, videos, embeds).
intent: user needs to maintain aspect ratio for media
user wants a responsive image container
user needs a 16:9 or 4:3 video wrapper

ratio.description: The desired aspect ratio expressed as width/height (e.g., 16/9, 4/3, 1)

ariaSupport: Children should have appropriate alt text
accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - layout utility, children handle accessibility

usage.when: User needs consistent aspect ratios for images, videos, or embeds
usage.avoid: Don't use when native CSS aspect-ratio suffices, don't use without media content

visually-hidden.name: VisuallyHidden
visually-hidden.description: Hides content visually while keeping it accessible to screen readers. Essential for accessible icon buttons and decorative elements.
intent: user needs screen reader only text
user wants to hide content visually but keep it accessible
user needs an accessible label for an icon button
user wants to provide screen reader context

ariaSupport: Content is announced by screen readers despite being visually hidden
accessibility.focusManagement: Not focusable (content within may be)
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - enables accessible names for visual-only elements

usage.when: User needs accessible text that should not be visible (icon button labels, decorative element descriptions)
usage.avoid: Don't use for content that users should see, use aria-label when VisuallyHidden is overkill

navigation-menu.name: NavigationMenu
navigation-menu.description: Complex navigation component with dropdown panels. Compound component: NavigationMenu, NavigationMenuList, NavigationMenuItem, NavigationMenuTrigger, NavigationMenuContent, NavigationMenuLink, NavigationMenuViewport, NavigationMenuIndicator.
intent: user needs a site navigation with dropdowns
user wants a horizontal navigation bar
user needs a mega menu
user wants a multi-level navigation

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when active item changes

delayDuration.description: Delay in ms before showing content on hover

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex in menu list, focus moves to content on open
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full keyboard navigation, ARIA menu pattern

usage.when: User needs primary site navigation with dropdown panels (header nav, mega menus)
usage.avoid: Don't use for action menus (use DropdownMenu), don't use for simple link lists

examples.code:
Products
  • Product A
  • Product B
 About

menubar.name: Menubar
menubar.description: Application menu bar (File, Edit, View pattern). Full compound component: Menubar, MenubarMenu, MenubarTrigger, MenubarContent, MenubarItem, MenubarSeparator, MenubarLabel, MenubarCheckboxItem, MenubarRadioItem, MenubarRadioGroup, MenubarSub, MenubarSubTrigger, MenubarSubContent, MenubarShortcut.
intent: user needs an application menu bar
user wants File/Edit/View style menus
user needs a horizontal menu with dropdowns
user wants a desktop application-style menu

inset.description: Adds left padding for menu items with icons (on MenubarItem/SubTrigger/Label)

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex in menubar, focus trapped in open menus
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - full menubar ARIA pattern

usage.when: Building desktop-style application interfaces with persistent menu bar
usage.avoid: Don't use for site navigation (use NavigationMenu), don't use for single dropdown (use DropdownMenu)

breadcrumb.name: Breadcrumb
breadcrumb.description: Navigation breadcrumb trail showing hierarchical location. Compound component: Breadcrumb, BreadcrumbList, BreadcrumbItem, BreadcrumbLink, BreadcrumbPage, BreadcrumbSeparator, BreadcrumbEllipsis.
intent: user needs a breadcrumb trail
user wants hierarchical navigation
user needs to show page location in hierarchy
user wants a path indicator

asChild.description: Render BreadcrumbLink as child element (e.g., router Link)

accessibility.focusManagement: Links are focusable, current page is aria-disabled
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - semantic nav, aria-current for current page

usage.when: User needs to understand and navigate page hierarchy (e-commerce, documentation, file browsers)
usage.avoid: Don't use for flat navigation (use Tabs or NavigationMenu), don't use with only one level

pagination.name: Pagination
pagination.description: Page navigation for paginated content. Compound component: Pagination, PaginationContent, PaginationItem, PaginationLink, PaginationPrevious, PaginationNext, PaginationEllipsis.
intent: user needs page navigation
user wants pagination controls
user needs previous/next page buttons
user wants numbered page links

isActive.description: Marks the current page link as active (on PaginationLink)

accessibility.focusManagement: Links are focusable, clear active state
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant - semantic navigation, clear active page

usage.when: User needs to navigate between pages of a large data set
usage.avoid: Don't use for small data sets (show all content), don't use for infinite scroll patterns

toggle-group.name: ToggleGroup
toggle-group.description: Group of toggle buttons for single or multiple selection. Shares button variants. Compound component: ToggleGroup, ToggleGroupItem.
intent: user needs a group of toggle buttons
user wants a segmented control
user needs multi-select button group
user wants a button-style radio or checkbox group

type.description: Whether one or multiple items can be selected

variant.description: Button variant applied to all items (inherits from Button variants)

size.description: Button size applied to all items

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex within group
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - keyboard operable, pressed state announcements

usage.when: User needs button-style toggles for view modes, formatting options, or filter selections
usage.avoid: Don't use for form selections (use RadioGroup or Checkbox), don't use for navigation (use Tabs)

examples.code:
<ToggleGroup type="multiple" variant="outline" size="sm">
  <ToggleGroupItem value="bold">B</ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="italic">I</ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="underline">U</ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

toolbar.name: Toolbar
toolbar.description: Action toolbar container for grouping related controls. Compound component: Toolbar, ToolbarButton, ToolbarSeparator, ToolbarToggleGroup, ToolbarToggleItem, ToolbarLink.
intent: user needs an action toolbar
user wants grouped controls in a bar
user needs a formatting toolbar
user wants to group related buttons and toggles

loop.description: Whether keyboard navigation wraps from last to first item

accessibility.focusManagement: Roving tabindex within toolbar
accessibility.wcag: WCAG 2.2 AAA compliant - ARIA toolbar pattern, keyboard operable

usage.when: User needs a horizontal or vertical bar of related actions (text formatting, editor tools, view controls)
usage.avoid: Don't use for navigation (use NavigationMenu), don't use for a single action (use Button)

stack.name: Stack
stack.description: Flex layout wrapper with density-aware spacing. Supports vertical and horizontal direction, gap control, alignment, justification, and wrap.
intent: user wants to layout items vertically
user wants to layout items horizontally
user needs a flex container with consistent spacing
user wants a simple column or row layout

direction.description: Flex direction. Vertical for columns, horizontal for rows.

spacing.description: Gap between children using density-aware design tokens.

as.description: Polymorphic element type (div, section, nav, ul, etc).

accessibility.role: When used as navigation (as='nav'), add aria-label
considerations: Use semantic element via as prop when appropriate (nav, section, main)

container.name: Container
container.description: Max-width wrapper with responsive padding. Centers content and constrains width using standard breakpoint presets.
intent: user wants a max-width content wrapper
user needs centered page content
user wants responsive container padding
user needs a prose-width container for reading

size.description: Max-width preset. Prose is optimized for reading (~65 characters).

accessibility.role: Use as='main' for main content area
considerations: Wrap in semantic landmark element for accessibility

examples.code:
<Container size="xl">
  <Heading level={1}>Page Title</Heading>
  <Text>Page content within constrained width.</Text>
</Container>

heading.name: Heading
heading.description: Semantic heading component (h1-h6) with fluid token-based typography. Supports independent visual size override from semantic level.
intent: user needs a page title
user wants a section heading
user needs semantic headings for accessibility
user wants fluid responsive headings

level.description: Semantic heading level. Determines the HTML element (h1-h6).

size.description: Visual size override. Defaults to matching the level.

considerations: Maintain proper heading hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3)
Use level for semantics and size for visuals independently

text.name: Text
text.description: Paragraph text component with size, weight, color, and alignment variants. Uses fluid design tokens for responsive typography.
intent: user needs paragraph text
user wants styled body text
user needs secondary or muted text
user wants colored text for status messages
user needs inline text with a span

size.description: Text size using fluid typography tokens.

as.description: Polymorphic element type (p, span, label, div, etc).

considerations: Ensure sufficient color contrast for secondary/tertiary variants
Use as='label' when labeling form inputs

examples.code:
<Text>Main paragraph text.</Text>
<Text size="sm" color="secondary">Secondary caption text.</Text>
<Text color="error">Error message text.</Text>

code.name: Code
code.description: Inline code snippet and multi-line code block components. CodeBlock supports language labels and line numbers.
intent: user wants to display inline code
user needs a code block
user wants syntax-highlighted code display
user needs to show code with line numbers

variant.description: Code: default has background highlight, ghost is plain text.

considerations: CodeBlock wraps in <pre> for whitespace preservation

blockquote.name: Blockquote
blockquote.description: Styled quote block with a left border accent. Supports semantic color variants for different contexts.
intent: user wants to display a quote
user needs a callout block
user wants a highlighted text block

variant.description: Border color variant for contextual meaning.

considerations: Use cite attribute for attribution when applicable

examples.code: Design is not just what it looks like. Design is how it works.

icon.name: Icon
icon.description: Icon wrapper component with consistent size and color tokens. Works with any SVG icon library (lucide-react, heroicons, etc).
intent: user wants to display an icon
user needs consistent icon sizing
user wants colored icons from design tokens

size.description: Icon size using component sizing tokens.

color.description: Icon color. 'current' inherits from parent text color.

label.description: Accessible label. When absent, icon is decorative (aria-hidden).

accessibility.role: img (when label provided), hidden when decorative
considerations: Always provide label for meaningful icons

image.name: Image
image.description: Enhanced image component with loading skeleton, error fallback, aspect ratio control, and rounded variants.
intent: user wants to display an image
user needs an image with loading state
user wants an image with error fallback
user needs aspect-ratio constrained images

search-bar.name: SearchBar
search-bar.description: Search input with icon, clear button, loading spinner, and keyboard shortcut hint. Self-contained composition component.
intent: user wants a search input
user needs a search bar with clear button
user wants search with loading state
user needs keyboard shortcut for search

onValueChange.description: Called when the search value changes.

confirm-dialog.name: ConfirmDialog
confirm-dialog.description: Pre-built confirmation dialog with title, description, and confirm/cancel actions. Supports danger variant for destructive actions.
intent: user wants a confirmation dialog
user needs a delete confirmation
user wants a destructive action confirmation
user needs a simple modal with confirm/cancel

examples.code:
<ConfirmDialog
  trigger={<Button variant="danger">Delete</Button>}
  title="Delete item?"
  description="This action cannot be undone."
  confirmText="Delete"
  variant="danger"
  onConfirm={deleteItem}
/>

user-menu.name: UserMenu
user-menu.description: Avatar-triggered dropdown menu showing user info and grouped action items. Self-contained with no external dependencies.
intent: user wants a user account menu
user needs an avatar dropdown
user wants a profile menu in the header
user needs sign out functionality

email.description: User email shown in menu header.

groups.description: Array of menu item groups with optional labels.

examples.code:
<UserMenu
  name="John Doe"
  email="john@example.com"
  avatarUrl="/avatar.jpg"
  groups={[
    { items: [{ label: 'Profile' }, { label: 'Settings' }] },
    { items: [{ label: 'Sign out', destructive: true }] },
  ]}
/>

DateRangePicker.name: DateRangePicker
DateRangePicker.description: Date range selection with built-in calendar dropdown. Two-step from/to flow with min/max date constraints. Self-contained with no external dependencies.
intent: user wants to select a date range
user needs a start and end date picker
user wants a calendar range selector
user needs check-in/check-out date input

value.description: Current range { from: Date | null, to: Date | null }.

examples.code:
const [range, setRange] = React.useState<DateRange>({ from: null, to: null });
<DateRangePicker value={range} onValueChange={setRange} minDate={new Date()} />

TimePicker.name: TimePicker
TimePicker.description: Time selection with hour/minute selects, 12/24h format, and configurable minute step. Uses native select elements for accessibility.
intent: user wants a time selector
user needs hour and minute input
user wants an AM/PM time picker
user needs appointment time selection

use12Hour.description: Use 12-hour format with AM/PM. Defaults to false.

minuteStep.description: Minute step interval (e.g. 15 for quarter hours). Defaults to 1.

considerations: Individual selects labeled Hour, Minute, Period

examples.code:
const [time, setTime] = React.useState('09:00');
<TimePicker value={time} onValueChange={setTime} use12Hour minuteStep={15} />

ColorPicker.name: ColorPicker
ColorPicker.description: Color selection with native color input, text entry for hex/oklch values, and preset swatches. Validates color values on blur.
intent: user wants a color selector
user needs a theme color picker
user wants to choose from color presets
user needs hex color input

value.description: Color value (hex string like #3b82f6 or oklch).

format.description: Display format for text input. Defaults to 'hex'.

presets.description: Preset color swatches. Defaults to 10 common colors.

considerations: Preset swatches use role=option with aria-selected

examples.code:
const [color, setColor] = React.useState('#3b82f6');
<ColorPicker value={color} onValueChange={setColor} label="Brand Color" />

FileUpload.name: FileUpload
FileUpload.description: Drag-and-drop file upload zone with preview thumbnails, file size validation, and per-file remove buttons. Supports multiple files and accept filters.
intent: user wants file upload functionality
user needs drag and drop file input
user wants image upload with preview
user needs multi-file upload

onFilesChange.description: Called when files are added or removed.

multiple.description: Allow multiple file selection. Defaults to false.

description.description: Helper text below the upload prompt.

considerations: Remove buttons have aria-label with file name

examples.code:
<FileUpload
  accept="image/*"
  multiple
  maxSize={5 * 1024 * 1024}
  onFilesChange={(files) => console.log(files)}
  description="PNG, JPG up to 5MB"
/>

FocusTrap.name: FocusTrap
FocusTrap.description: Traps keyboard focus within a container element. Wraps Tab/Shift+Tab to cycle through focusable elements. Supports initial focus, escape key handler, and returning focus on deactivation.
intent: user wants to trap focus in a modal
user needs focus management for dialogs
user wants to prevent focus from leaving a container
user needs accessible keyboard navigation

active.description: Whether the focus trap is active. Defaults to true.

returnFocusOnDeactivate.description: Return focus to previously focused element on deactivate. Defaults to true.

initialFocus.description: CSS selector for initial element to focus.

clickOutsideDeactivates.description: Allow clicking outside the trap to deactivate.

SkipNav.name: SkipNav
SkipNav.description: Skip to main content navigation link. Visually hidden until focused, providing keyboard users a way to bypass navigation and jump to main content.
intent: user wants skip navigation link
user needs skip to main content
user wants to improve keyboard accessibility
user needs WCAG skip navigation

children.description: Link text. Defaults to 'Skip to main content'.

considerations: Visually hidden until focused via Tab
Links to content target via ID

Announcement.name: Announcement
Announcement.description: Screen reader live region for dynamic announcements. Renders a visually hidden aria-live region that announces message changes to assistive technology.
intent: user wants screen reader announcements
user needs aria-live region
user wants to announce dynamic content changes
user needs accessible status messages

politeness.description: Politeness level. 'polite' waits for idle, 'assertive' interrupts. Defaults to 'polite'.

clearAfterMs.description: Clear the announcement after this many milliseconds.

considerations: Uses aria-live for screen reader announcements
aria-atomic ensures full content is read
Supports polite and assertive politeness levels

form.name: Form Pattern
form.description: Standard form layout with inputs, labels, validation, and submission
form.example: Use FormField for each input with FormLabel, FormControl, FormHelperText, and FormErrorMessage. Use Input for text, Select for dropdowns, Checkbox for boolean, RadioGroup for single-select, Button for submit.

authentication.name: Authentication Pattern
authentication.example: Card container with CardHeader for title, CardContent with email/password FormField inputs, Checkbox for 'remember me', CardFooter with primary submit Button and Link for 'forgot password'.

dataEntry.name: Data Entry Pattern
dataEntry.description: Complex forms with multiple fields and validation
dataEntry.example: Multi-step forms using Tabs for sections, FormField with validation for each input, Select for enums, Textarea for long text, Slider for ranges, DateRangePicker for date ranges, TimePicker for time selection, ColorPicker for colors, FileUpload for attachments, Button for submit.

modal.name: Modal Pattern
modal.description: Modal dialogs for focused tasks, confirmations, and forms
modal.example: Use Dialog for general modals with forms. Use AlertDialog for destructive confirmations. DialogTrigger on a Button, DialogContent with DialogHeader (title + description), form fields in body, DialogFooter with cancel (ghost/outline) and confirm (primary/danger) Buttons.

navigation.name: Navigation Pattern
navigation.description: Application navigation with menus, breadcrumbs, and pagination
navigation.example: NavigationMenu for primary site nav with dropdown panels. Breadcrumb below header for page hierarchy. Tabs for sub-page navigation. Pagination for data tables. Sheet (side=left) for mobile navigation. Menubar for desktop app-style interfaces.

feedback.name: Feedback Pattern
feedback.description: Loading states, alerts, toasts, and progress indicators
feedback.example: Skeleton for initial page load placeholders. Spinner inline in buttons during submission. Progress for upload/download bars. Toast for transient success/error messages. Alert for persistent warnings/info. Badge for status indicators on cards and lists.

layout.name: Layout Pattern
layout.description: Content organization with layout primitives, cards, accordions, tabs, and separators
layout.example: Container for max-width page wrapper. Stack for vertical/horizontal flex layouts with density-aware spacing. Heading for semantic h1-h6 with fluid typography. Text for body text with color variants. Card grid for dashboard widgets. Accordion for FAQ. Tabs for switching views. Separator between sections.

dashboard.name: Dashboard Pattern
dashboard.description: Data display with cards, progress indicators, badges, and interactive elements
dashboard.example: Grid of Cards with CardTitle for metrics, Progress bars for KPIs, Badge for status labels (success/warning/destructive). Avatar for user lists. Tabs to switch between dashboard views. DropdownMenu on cards for actions (export, share, delete). Skeleton for loading state.

tokens.spacing: All spacing uses density-aware tokens that respond to data-density attribute (compact/default/comfortable)
tokens.color: All colors use semantic tokens that adapt to theme (light/dark/high-contrast)
tokens.typography: Typography uses fluid scaling with clamp() for responsive text sizing
tokens.sizing: Component heights use --sizing-component-height-{sm,md,lg} tokens for consistent interactive element sizing
tokens.borderRadius: All components share --component-button-border-radius for consistent rounding
